snippet: The confrontation highlighted hair-trigger tensions in the South China Sea as East Asian nations try to contain China’s more aggressive posture in pursuing maritime claims.
abstract: Tensions rise in the South China Sea as Vietnamese naval vessels confront Chinese ships that were working to place an oil rig off Vietnam's coast; Vietnamese officials claim that their ships were rammed by the Chinese vessels three days earlier, amid other provocations.

byline.original: By GERRY MULLANY and DAVID BARBOZA
byline.contributor: Gerry Mullany reported from Hong Kong, and David Barboza from Shanghai. Floyd Whaley contributed reporting from Manila, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong. Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The confrontation highlighted hair-trigger tensions in the South China Sea as East Asian nations try to contain China’s more aggressive posture in pursuing maritime claims.

headline.main: Vietnam Squares Off With China in Disputed Seas
headline.print_headline: Vietnam Navy Squares Off With Chinese in Disputed Seas
